Name: Seduxion
Description:
Seduxion - The game of dice that melts the Ice

The game comes with 8 differnt dice and a scoring pad along with a small rule sheet.

Each of the dice have one face with Lips, Serpents, Apples, fig leaves and Cupids on them. The 6th face contains one letter of the word SEDUXION. 5 of the dice are black the 3 red dice which have the letters S,E,X on it are red. (This combination scores a special bonus)

In turn each player throws all 8 dice and may leave down any, none, or all the dice thrown. Up to 3 rolls are permitted per turn. You get points for more than 3 of the same symbols or have more than 7 differnt faces shown and for making words with at least 3 letters

Example: After 3 rolls you got: 4 Cupids and D, I, E, X. This counts 5 points for the 4 Cupids and 10 points for the word DIE, a total of 15 points. The word SEX gots a special bonus of 30 points.

Every field on the score sheet can be used only once, like in Yatzee. You have to cross out the field on the score sheet. After ten turns one column is finished and the points are calculated together. The games ends here or goes up for 2 other columns on the same score sheet. The winner of a column gets a 50 point bonus.

Should you get SEDUXION at any time this will ends the game and you win the game. In a 3 column game the winner takes a 100 point bonus and all other lose their point on that column.

(from the rules and user summary)

Name: The Gauntlet
Description:
In the dark depths of a drifting space wreck, a small team of specialists investigates unusual scanner readings of life on board.  The team acts relaxed; banter hides their anxiety.  Motion scanners show nothing; torches illuminate the dank corridor casting long shadows.

Suddenly the point man's scanner shows movement ahead, increasing in speed.  His reflexes are conditioned by experience, so he shoulders the carbine.  The torch illuminates a horrific shape.  Recognising danger the point man fires the carbine in a rapid series of bursts.

An alien screeches of pain and the creature falls to the ground.  You have just made first contact.

More motion scanners come to life, movement all around you starts closing in through the maze of ship's corridors.  This is more than five men can handle.  It is time to withdraw back to the assault shuttle.

What is The Gauntlet?

The Gauntlet is a print 'n play board game for 1-6 players.  Designed as an entertaining tactical-action and strategy game, the game is based around teaching leadership concepts and team work.

Players are tasked with a simple mission, get the team to safety.  Players choose their leaders and role within the team, each team character has unique skills or abilities which can be used to advantage by the team and individual.  The teams leader guides the play of the game, allowing the individuals to create team work to support each other.

The play is fast and furious, players quickly mastering the simple mechanics designed to focus the players on making decisions than working out how to play.  Within minutes players will be talking, making decisions and blasting aliens.

The game is over in 35 turns or 45 minutes, whichever comes first.

The Gauntlet is even suitable for solo play.

What do I get?

The game is available in a downloadable PDF format.  You have the choice as to how the game will be printed and presented to fit your needs.  The game includes;

+  a complete full colour board detailing a section of the space ship.

+  stand-up counters for the humans and aliens.

+  3d components (containers, boxes and rubble).

+  optional 3d components to create the walls and structure of the space ship.

+  a complete rules guide with examples of play.

+  a guide to assembly.

Not included are six (6) regular six-sided dice (the game can be played with less, six being the ideal).

The game may be produced with the minimal components or with option 3d componentry that creates an incredible game board that gives the game an incredible look and feel.

You can print the game on your own colour printer or have it proffessionally printed by a 3rd party printing service.  A heavy card stock of around 200gsm is reccommended.  The board could be printed on full page label stock.  In either case they can be mounted on very heavy cardboard, wood sheets or even foam boards.

Assembly is quick and easy.

(Edutainment Games, www.edutainment-games.com)

Name: Memo Fantasy
Description:
This is a memory-game for the very young.  10 stars cover 5 picture pairs in the sky. The first player picks up two stars and if the pictures underneath are the same the stars are kept.  If not, the stars go back into the sky.  Then the second player picks up two stars, etc.  Who will collect the most stars?  To play a NEW game there is the possibility to change the picture-plates underneath, fitting the colors, around the holes in the corners, to the same colors of the pegs.  There are two plates, printed on both sides, that give four different possibilities.  To add even more playing possibilities, there are 5 papers included for drawing, or gluing pictures or photos.  
To practice before playing memo, you can start with a simple game, where you look for each pair.  One picture is covered with a star, who will find the same picture?

Name: Les Acrobates
Description:
Each player gets a set of acrobats (1 through 5). The objective is to stack the acrobats one on top of the other (from 1 to 5).

Throwing the die; the highest throw starts. Each player throws the die until they get a 1, then a 2 and so on to stack the 5 acrobats. A player who throws a 6 loses a turn. If the stack of acrobats falls, the player will have to start again from 1. (source from the directions on the box)

Name: Aguila Roja Junior
Description:
Aguila Roja is a card game where you can play with characters from the hit television show. In each round, all players try to play the best card to earn as much as possible marvedies (money). They play several games in a row, and the player gets two cards wins the game Red Feather


Águila Roja Junior es un juego de cartas en el que podréis jugar con los personajes de la famosa serie de televisión. En cada turno, todos los jugadores tratan de jugar la mejor carta para ganar la mayor cantidad de maravedís posible. Se juegan varias partidas seguidas, y el jugador que consiga las dos fichas de Pluma Roja gana el juego.

Name: Spillet om de tre bukkene Bruse
Description:
A childrens game based on the traditional Norwegian fairytale about the three billy goats who had to cross a bridge where a troll lives.

There is a total of nine billy goats in this game. Three in each color. On your turn you roll a color die and a "normal" die. You move one of the goats of the color the first die shows the number the second die shows. When you come to the bridge you have to draw a troll card to see if the Troll eats the goat.

Each player should collect goats from one color, but the color you collect changes when you reach a "switch color" token.
Families: Series: Fra meg til deg (Damm / Egmont)

Name: The Everlasting Glory: Chinese War of Resistance 1937-1945
Description:
The Everlasting Glory (è‹±çƒˆåƒç§‹) is the first independent box wargame made by Formosa Force Games. It is a two-player operational wargame simulates the War of Resistance (æŠ—æˆ°ï¼‰1937-45. One player commands the Imperial Japanese Army (å¤§æ—¥æœ¬å¸åœ‹é™¸è»ï¼‰and the other player commands the National Revolutionary Armyï¼ˆåœ‹æ°‘é©å‘½è»).

Leonard To who is the designer of War of the Sunsï¼ˆå¤©ç„¡äºŒæ—¥ï¼‰ tried to use another way to show the history of War of Resistance in this new game.
The Everlasting Glory (è‹±çƒˆåƒç§‹) uses the same research and basic game concepts as War of the Suns: The War of Resistance 1937-1945, while focusing less on the non-military aspects.

There are also 4 fundamental changes in the game design:
1. The use of area movement instead of hexes. Each area is a province. It speeds up the game. By organizing combats in an area, similar dynamic like that of hex and counters has been maintained.
2. The use of generic units instead of unit IDs. This is a tough choice. It reduces the effort of the player to locate individual units, and makes it more flexible in losses and breakdowns calculations. Historical unit IDs are provided in the OB for those who are interested in unit history.
3. A 2-players instead of a 3-players game. The game is now played between the KMT and Japan players. Game mechanism controls CCP. British and part of the Japanese forces in India and Burma are removed cause they do not represent the core of the Chinese struggle. It again speeds up the game, and removes a player who has little to do sometimes.
4. The use of cards. This is not a card-driven game but strategy, command and logistics cards are included to handle those aspects.

There are 6 scenarios included: 

    1 Campaign scenario
    2 Operational scenarios: Space for Time, Operation Ichigo 
    3 Introductory scenarios: Fist of Fury, Retreat to Victory, Plan B


Components:

    540 5/8" counters
    60 Cards in English, 60 Cards in Chinese
    1 A1 map in Chinese & English (mounted)
    1 Chinese & English Rule book
    1 Chinese & English Scenario book

Name: Compass and Empire
Description:
Compass and Empire is a Print and Play Game themed for the Aether Captains world

Played with 6 dice, five dice showing the Emperor, Lady and Compass faces, and one die known as the ‘Roundabout’, this game is for two to four players. You will also need the provided set of 12 tokens (or coins if the officers are elsewhere).

Play:
At the start of a game the following number of tokens are placed in the center of the playing area, depending on the number of players taking part:

4 players: 3 Emperor tokens, 6 Compass tokens, and 3 Lady tokens
3 players: 2 Emperor tokens, 4 Compass tokens, and 2 Lady tokens
2 players: 1 Emperor tokens, 2 Compass tokens, and 1 Lady token

Choose who goes first.

Players, clockwise in turn, roll the dice once and try to get five-of-a-kind. Players may keep as many of the previous player's dice and roll the remaining ones in their turn.

A player who rolls 5 Compass tokens (regardless if it is the Compass or the Marked Compass) claims one Compass token from the center. A player who rolls 5 Emperor tokens claims one Emperor token from the center. A player who rolls 5 Lady tokens claims one Lady token from the center.

Once a player has made five-of-a-kind and claimed their reward, the next player rolls all the dice to start the next round. If a player is unable to claim their reward from the center because there are none left, they may take one from another player.

If 3 Marked Compass die faces are rolled that player may take the ‘roundabout’ die to use during future turns; rolling it once when taking it to determine its use during the time the player has control of it. The player can only lose that die if another player rolls 3 Marked Compasses and takes it from them.

This die gives the player the following bonuses:

The Engineer - the player is allowed to take a token on a 4 of a kind
(a crafty engineer always makes the best of a situation)

The Mistress - the player allowed to take a 2nd roll of any dice they choose
(one girl here and one girl there)

The Cutpurse - the player can choose one die which will be locked and
cannot be re-rolled by an adjacent player to their left or right as indicated by the die
(the left hand never knows what the right is doing)

The Alchemist - the player may choose any token in center not yet taken
i.e. acts as a 5 wild
(lead turns to gold)

The Spy - The Roundabout die is lost by that player and placed back in the center
(your secrets will gain you nothing)

The first player to hold a Emperor, Lady and two Compass tokens wins the game.

this game is based on the ancient roman game Jactus

Name: Let's Jet
Description:
From game rules for "Basic" game:

Draw three "public cards" from the Travel deck and place them directly on the map.  Deal each player four Travel cards, and give each player a jet pawn and scoring chip.  Each player chooses one of their cards as their starting location and puts their jet pawn on that city.  Put the card they chose in front of that player to begin a scoring pile, and put their scoring chip on the 1 on the scoring track.

On a player's turn, their jet can make two "hops" as measured using the distance ruler.

Each time a player stops in a city shown on a "public card" or one of their own Travel cards, they take that card and add it to their scoring pile, then move their scoring chip on the scoring track.
				
				
					=========="Advanced" game features additional rules for Event cards, Bonus abilities awarded for completing a set of three cards of the same color, and CoPilot cards awarded when another player visits a Travel card you're holding.

Bonus cards: 
8x Extra jet power (longer hops)
4x Experienced flight crew (extra hop each turn)
4x Extra capacity x4 (hold more cards - also worth a bonus point)
2x Seaplane (can land in water - also worth a bonus point)
4x Collector cards that each double the value of a different color
1x Prestige card worth 3 points

WHAT THEY'LL LEARN: Geography, Strategy, World Facts


     Sequel: Let's Drive

Name: Dookoła Świata z Janem Pawłem II
Description:
This game was officially released in October 2010 to mark the 32nd anniversary of John Paul's election as pope, although several hundred copies had already been sold.

A dice roll allows a player to travel to many of the 130 countries where the pope traveled where players collect cards with the Pope's messages.

Name: Last Night on Earth: The Zombie Game – Radioactive Zombies with Grave Weapons Supplement
Description:
From the FFP website:

We will include Promo cards Flashlight & Pitchfork and "Here They Come!" with this purchase. Zombies with Grave Weapons in crystal green/radioactive color. 7 zombies, each unique, in this set.
Families: Series: Last Night on Earth Game Engine (Flying Frog Production)

Name: Invasion from Outer Space: Advanced Abilities Supplement
Description:
From the FFP website:

The IFOS - Advanced Abilities Supplement is a Web-exclusive for Invasion From Outer Space and features 4 new game cards for the Martian and Hero Decks and 10 new Advanced Ability cards (8 Hero and 2 Martian) as well as the new rules for using them. All pieces are printed on the same high-quality card stock as the boardgame. The cards are exclusive to this supplement and will not be available anywhere else.

The new Advanced Abilities cards can be added to any existing Scenario as a way for both the Heroes and the Martians to gain experience during games unlocking powerful new abilities. There is a unique Advanced Ability for each Hero character, allowing each to level-up and use a super-powered version of his or her Talent (requiring the use of a full 3 Power Tokens), as well as global abilities that the Martians can get.
Families: Series: Last Night on Earth Game Engine (Flying Frog Production)

Name: Last Night on Earth 'Advanced Abilities' Supplement
Description:
From the FFP website:

The LNOE - Advanced Abilities Supplement is a Web-exclusive for Last Night on Earth and features eight new game cards for the Zombie and Hero Decks and 20 new Advanced Ability cards (16 Hero and 4 Zombie) as well as the new rules for using them. All pieces are printed on the same high-quality card stock as the boardgame. The cards are exclusive to this supplement and will not be available anywhere else.

The new Advanced Abilities cards can be added to any existing Scenario as a way for both the Heroes and the Zombies to gain experience during games unlocking powerful new abilities. There is a unique Advanced Ability for each Hero character, allowing them to level-up, as well as global abilities that the Zombies can get.
Families: Series: Last Night on Earth Game Engine (Flying Frog Production)

Name: Royal Court (fan expansion for Dominion)
Description:
(from the download document)

This is a fan based expansion created by Mike Young for the game Dominion.

These cards may be used to create standalone sets or may be added to mixes from other Dominion expansions.

This set introduces the concepts of:

     Kingdom cards where not all the cards in the pile are identical.
     Duration cards that last for more than 1 turn.   
     Duration cards that allow players to perform an action instead of playing an action card.
     Use tokens to determine when or if a card has been used.

Name: Chicken Feed Stampede!
Description:
It's feeding time for the chickens, and you've got a lot of hungry mouths to feed in your hen house. So out into the barnyard you go, looking for tasty spiders, worms, beetles, and bits of corn. All you need to do is grab it and bring it back to your henhouse. Unfortunately, there are a lot of other chickens in the yard that are trying to grab the same food! Will you be able to successfully maneuver your chickens to collect the most food and feed your flock?

In Chicken Feed Stampede!, players control a pair of chickens trying to collect food as they run around the barnyard. While doing so, they have to avoid other chickens and the fox, which chases the chickens to the edge of the barnyard, forcing them to the edge to start over.

Each player uses a set of eight action cards to determine how their chickens are moved each turn.

There are four different kinds of food available, and each gives the player who collects it a different ability or score. Player order is managed by placing their turn markers on the "Pecking Order" board. Clever management of your actions to stay at the top of the pecking order is needed to win the game.

The game board is comprised of a grid of various terrain tiles. A chicken's movement ability is based on the terrain of the tile it starts its move from. Using the boulders and gravel paths gets you around faster, but sometimes you need to get into the grass to collect the food you need.

Components
   - Modular Board featuring barnyard terrain
   - 12 chicken tokens (chickeneeples!) in six colors
   - 48 chicken action cards
   - 36 food tokens (spiders, worms, beetles and corn)
   - one fox token
   - 6 chicken turn marker tokens
   - 6 Rooster Crow special power tokens

Name: Das große Welt der Wunder Wissensspiel
Description:
A trivia game as a tie-in of the (in Germany) popular-Science-show "Welt der Wunder" (World of wonders).
Players move arounf the board, answering questions or have to memorize shapes or words.

Name: 長元記 (Chō Gen Ki)
Description:
ChÅ Gen Ki (Record of ChÅsokabe Motochika) covers battles in the Shikoku region fought by ChÅsokabe Motochika.
Six scenarios are included.

Each players control one or more clans. Each clan regroups combat units.
There are four action segments in each game turn. The number of segments during which each troop can act is decided by commander's activation ability. Action that can be selected are movement, field combat, siege, moral recovery, reorganization and replacement.

The victor of the game is the player who gains the most victory points. Victory point are provided by the control of castlse and the removal of enemy units.


Note: "ChÅ Gen Ki" (é•·å…ƒè¨˜) - "ChÅ" is ChÅsokabe Motochika; "Ki" is a record.

The game was first designed as a self-published expansion kit in 2006 and republished in 2021 as an independent game that includes standard rules (Game Journal 80).

Name: Kanhasshu Kosenroku
Description:
This is self-published expansion kit for é–¢æ±åˆ¶åœ§ (Kanto Seiatsu).
"Kanhasshu Kosenroku" means "Record of Ancient Battles in 8 States of Kanto Region".

Covering battles of Hojo clan before and after period of é–¢æ±åˆ¶åœ§ (Kanto Seiatsu).
Six scenarios are included in this kit.

Also need to play Standard rule (Late version), Reference card and Map #2 from é–¢æ±åˆ¶åœ§ (Kanto Seiatsu).

Name: Битвы Fantasy
Description:
In this fantasy miniatures game players each create an army with the same number of points (with each miniature having a different point value), then take turns moving and attacking until all of the opponent's forces are dead or captured. Players can use special magic and ability cards to provide advantage for their armies.
Unique game mechanic also allows players to launch small plastic missiles with heavy machines (such as ballista or catapult), physically knocking out enemy forces from the battle.

The universe of Fantasy Battles includes various epochs and genres, from fantasy cratures and gladiators to napoleonic wars and cossacks.

Usually each set includes 20 miniatures of characters or creatures, 4-6 warmachines, a deck of magic or ability cards 1 die and techsheets for each unit. Many sets also contain modular structures, such as walls or castle towers.

Name: Император 3 (Emperor 3)
Description:
This fantasy-themed miniatures wargame is set on a hexagonal map with dimensions of 5X7 hexes with special 2 hexes marked as "castles". The goal of this game is to defeat all enemy forces or capture his "castle" hex.
Player may reinforce their armies by purchasing additional units during the game process. Also players may build walls and towers on hex borders to defend their castles.

This game is developed based on ideas from Ð˜Ð¼Ð¿ÐµÑ€Ð°Ñ‚Ð¾Ñ€ and Ð˜Ð¼Ð¿ÐµÑ€Ð°Ñ‚Ð¾Ñ€ 2 games.

Components:
32 warrior miniatures
10 plasic bases with flag and 3 slots for units
12 plastic towers
16 plastic walls
20 gold tokens
1 game map
1 rulebook
1 die

Name: Color Mio
Description: Color Mio is a Halli-Galli style speed card game about color mix matching instead of fruit counting. Players try to match one of two open palette card colors with combination of paint cards as fast as possible, opened by each player's turn. The correct player takes all open paint cards of every players and the matched palette card(s) is replaced with new one. After all palette cards are matched two times, the player with the most paint cards wins the game.

Name: Jihad !
Description:
Jihad is a variant kit based on "Belisarius" published on S&T 224.
Original game, "Belisarius" was published in the Decision Games Strategy & Tactics magazine #210.

"Jihad !" is a wargame simulating the early expansion of Islam in the period of the Caliphs Omar and Othman (634-656 AD) when is 100 years after the parent game.

"Jihad !" is a two player game. The Caliphate player controls the forces of the Islam. The Kingdom player controls various non-caliphate kingdoms. Each player’s forces are represented by military units and Stratagem markers. Players must use a combination of military strength and cunning strategy to maintain and increase their power.

The rules are based on the Charlemagne (S&T #189) and Xenophon (S&T #203) games. And this system was later used in Khan (S&T #229).

Name: Samurai Wars: juego de simulación estratégica en el Japón medieval
Description:
(From the Introduction)

Samurai Wars is a game sited in medieval Japan. Each player represents a "Grand Lord", confronted with the other players for the control of lands and resources (mines, hamlets, castles...) in a combination of stretegy, planification, risk, diplomacy and (mostly) war.

In a game turn, each player must collect his resources in order to pay his army and, or recruit new units. after he can attack at his rivals, or ally with others, or be betrayed for his former allies. In this confussed scenario also are present the peasants, sometimes violent, sometimes powerless..., and the Ninjas, special units who can kill  a "Grand Lord", removing it for the game.

The game units are completd with infantry, bowmen (each represents ten men), and the powerfull samurais.

At the end of the game (20 turns), the winner is the player with most resources controlled. If there is a tie, the game is played one more turn.

Name: Heavy Gear Arena
Description:
What is Arena? It's in your face! It's multi-ton robots trashing each other! It's all about drama on the field and off the field! This isn't your slow paced hack fest! This is Gears kicking tail and taking names!

Hire the best. Kit your Gears. Slug it out with the best. Only one team can rise to the top, but do you have what it takes to win?

Heavy Gear Arena is a fast paced, highly customizable tactical battle game set in the award winning Heavy Gear setting. For centuries, Terra Nova's best pilots have taken their Gears, advanced robotic fighting machines, and pitted them against each other in the world of sports dueling. Only the best stay in the games and earn their legendary reputations. Of course, reputations only get you so far. Winning equals money for upgrading your team and its equipment, the support of your adoring fans brings fame and more importantly the corporate sponsors, or just the thrills, pilots come from all over to find the thing they're desperate for in Khayr ad-Din.

Take on the role of team manager and build up your team to pit against the competition.

What you'll find in Heavy Gear Arena:

Robust tournament campaign rules
Duelists capable of growing in experience and talent
In depth Gear Customization
Support Personnel to aid your team's growth
Fast paced combat with combo chains and Duelist Talents

Name: Clara's garden
Description:
Clara's garden is game for 2-6 players. You need 1 set of nestortiles and 1 men for every player.

In Clara's garden is 60 flowers in ten colors. Flowers are in various class (1-6). Goal is pick most valuable flowers for bouquet where every flower will be in different color.

Components
- Nestortiles A-Type (60 tiles) 
- One man for every player.

Setup
Before game players create random map of garden from nestortiles in grid 10x10.

Play
First move: All players in order put his man on tiles with value 1.

Next move: Player pick up tile and move his man diagonally, horizontally or vertically any number of squares. Only one man can be on square. Man can jumps over oposite men.

Game continue with next moves. Because empty fields cannot be crossed, isolated islands of tiles could be removed. Player can pick up more tiles with the color. But into final score will be counted only one most valuable flower for every color.
If player has no move, she picks up last tile and passes next moves.

End of game
Game is finished when one player has completed bouquet (she has tiles of all ten colors) or when all players are out of moves. Score is counted as sum of points of all flowers. If player has more flowers of the same color, only most valuable flower is counted. Player with best score is winner.

In Rule book there are Advanced rules too.

Name: Arena Assault: Samurai vs Ninja
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

Battle as a honorable Samurai or a deadly Ninja.  Grab a group or friends, blast, pound and bash them into mud on your way to victory.  Arena Assault is an expandable card game compatible with all other Arena Assault games and decks.  Games are fast and furious, even with large groups, allowing for many battles to be played in one game session.  Includes two 50 card decks, rules and 20 Arena Gear cards.  So, gear up and get ready for battle.

Name: Arena Assault: Catfight
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

Battle as a heavy hitting Athena or a versatile Purrtek.  Grab a group or friends, blast, pound and bash them into kitty litter on your way to victory.  Arena Assault is an expandable card game compatible with all other Arena Assault games and decks.  Games are fast and furious, even with large groups, allowing for many battles to be played in one game session.  Includes two 50 card decks, rules and 20 Arena Gear cards.  So, gear up and get ready for battle.

Name: Arena Assault: Robot War
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

Battle as a powerhouse Crusher or a fusion blasting Robozon.  Grab a group of friends, blast, pound and bash them into dust on your way to victory.  Arena Assault is an expandable card game compatible with all other Arena Assault games and decks.  Games are fast and furious, even with large groups, allowing for many battles to be played in one game session.  Includes two 50 card decks, rules and 20 Arena Gear cards.  So, gear up and get ready for battle.

Name: Good: the Battle
Description:
"It's War!! ...but in a nice way."

Good: the Battle is a miniatures based combat skirmish game, in which you take the role of a character or characters and attempt to defeat your opponents by doing good and inflicting bad upon them. The core game, designed by us at Project Good is the game of Good: the Battle. The uniqueness of Good: The Battle is it's ability to use any genre, any miniatures, anywhere, anything else...? Yes there is, but it's all Good...

Unlike the heavily stat-based games that you see everywhere nowadays, Good: the battle turns these statistics  into two basic attributes; Good and bad. Obviously the better you are at things (shooting, close combat, healing, etc.) the longer you will survive in this world, but everyone has a limit of how much Good they can do. Nasty things like damage, curses, etc can only be described as Bad things, but sometimes a bit of bad is exactly what is needed.

There are thousands, probably hundreds of thousands, of character miniature manufacturers out there; and every single one of these can be used in Good: the Battle - regardless of scale, setting, period, race, etc. Good: the Battle uses the actual miniature to give you benefits in the game. For example; a miniature equipped with swords will be better in close combat, than somebody with none. A miniature carrying a rocket launcher will obviously do more damage if it shoots you in the head. Huge dragons will have more hit points, and mice will have less. But this doesn't mean a one-armed dwarf mute who's only weapon is a bag full of dead hamsters won't be able to put up a fight...

Name: Mystery Gun
Description:
This game features a circular metal lithographed playing board, which is very similar to a metal tray.  The board has a "gun" at the bottom which shoots metal balls at metal airplanes which are placed at the 4 predetermined positions near the top half of the board.  A pullstring is wrapped around the spinner and then it is pulled like a top.  The metal balls are then loaded into the left side of the "gun" and the spinning mechanism "fires" the balls out the other side of the gun in rapid fire.  The metal airplanes have a ball-bearing on the underside of the planes that allows them to rest in the holes near the top of the board.  When a fired shot hits the airplane it is dislodged from its position and it falls toward the bottom of the playing area, thus crashing into the ground.   The player then scores points based on which airplanes are shot down.  Each player gets a set number of "shots" and the player with the most points after all players have taken their shots wins the game.  
This game is made by McDowell Mfg. and was manufactured around the 1930's.

Name: Stir 'em Up! The Flipping & Switching Word Game
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

This is no ordinary crossword game...it's unpredictable, it's fast-paced, it's Stir 'em Up! Scoop the letters out of the bowl, but don't get attached - the die may force you to flip them or switch them. And once it's time for everyone to make their own crosswords, don't dawdle - you've got 30 seconds to use more letters than everyone else!

User Summary

Once everyone has their letters, roll the die to stir things up! If the die shows a color, everyone must flip over those color tiles they have. If it lands on "right," they take two tiles from the person  to their right. If it lands on "left," they pass two tiles to the person to their left. Now ask them to
try to form a word with the tiles. The word must have at least three letters (no
one- or two-letter words). The person to announce a word gets the points for that word. Continue playing until all tiles have been used or you run out of room on the board.

Name: Cascade
Description: A tower is filled with 5 columns of coloured balls. Each player can on their turn take as many balls of the same colour from the bottom of the columns as they want. The winner is the player who has taken the most balls at the end of the game.

Name: Bowl' Em  Over
Description:
Set up the 12 bowling pins and aim to get a strike. This game is fun for everyone and will unleash your competitive side!

Object of the game is to knock all the bowling pins down and score a strike.


Comes with: 1 Bowling Alley, 12 Bowling Pins, 2 side supports 
1 Score Sheets 
1 Instruction Sheet 
2 Bowling Balls 
1 Monkey Bowler

Name: The Zoo Break Game
Description:
From the front cover: The animals are escaping.  Capture the most to win and become head zoo keeper.

User summary: A roll-and-move game where the players are zookeepers trying to catch all of the animals that have escaped from the zoo.  Based on the roll of a die in the game's unique elephant dice tower, a player will either move his pawn the indicated number of spaces, attempting to land on and capture an animal, or follow the instructions on an event card.  When all of the animals have been captured, the player with the most animals wins.

Name: Gulf War
Description:
Excerpt from page 3 of the rules: Gulf War involves the use of military maneuvers and the careful use and selection of weapons, in order to achieve sea, ground and air supremacy.  Gulf War is made up of two teams, regardless of the number of players.

Excerpt from page 1 of the rules:
Long Version (Game One): The object of game 1 is to completely destroy and eliminate your enemy from the game board by using your various weapons.
Short Version (Game Two): The object of game 2 is to maneuver your flag on the game board, as well as protect it by using your various weapons.  In addition, weapons must eliminate your opponent's flag to achieve victory.

From the front of the box:
Dedicated to all those who helped liberate Kuwait!

Name: Spotcha!
Description:
The Wild, Which-Way-Did-They-Land Game

Spotcha! takes fast eyes and faster hands. Start by tossing the 18 oddball objects and watch how they land. Flip a card and the race is on. Is the lawn mower rightside-up? Is the ghost face down? Look, the wizard hat is on its side! Quick, grab the correct scoring flags before anyone else. Everybody plays on every turn, so it's all-out, mad-cap fun for everyone!

Name: Texel Info Toerspel
Description:
"An informative route game around the island of Texel"

This is a roll-and-move game published to promote tourism on the Dutch island of Texel. The players throw the die to move their pawn across 87 spaces on a map of the island; the first player to reach the finish, wins.

Name: Black Eagles: A Game of the Great Slave Rebellions of Santo Domingo (Haiti) 1790-1804
Description:
Toussaint L’Ouverture and the slave insurrections in Saint-Domingue (now Haiti), the richest trading colony in the new world,  shocked and terrified Western Nations. Not since Spartacus had slave rebellions succeeded on such a grand scale. However, this story cannot be confined to a single leader like Toussaint. It is far more complicated, riddled with intrigue and rife with defections. There is no shortage of villains, and heroes are often conflicted. On the surface, the topic is obscure but the ramifications for this conflict were incredibly far-reaching.

Black Eagles is a card assisted, multi-player, area movement cube game that covers the period 1792-1804. Black Eagles is broken into four distinct scenarios: the "Rights of Man," or the introduction of republican ideals to the island; "Imperial Designs," or the invasion of English and Spanish forces; "Civil War," internal conflict between the Mulattos and the rebel leaders; and finally "Leclerc Invades," featuring Napoleon's attempt to restore slavery to the island.

Black Eagles allows one (yes, there is a solitaire version) to four players to command one of five historical rebel leaders, Toussaint L'Ouverture included, as well as Napoleon's veteran general Charles Victoire Emmanuel Leclerc. Those not commanded by players become factions available for alliance, along with the Gros Blancs, the Petits Blancs, the Spanish, the French, and the English, each provides the controlling player with a special ability. Alliances are fluid, as is the allegiance of the very units under your command. The more of the island's economy a player controls the more havoc he can cause with the funds he collects. On the other hand, the player who carries the least influence automatically controls the Petits Blancs and no matter how weak a player is, he can always attack a stronger player's economic base.

Black Eagles is no longer in its infancy. Play testing has proven it to be well worthwhile. Scenario play ranges from 90 minutes to four hours. Components include a 22" by 34" map, 45 card events that affect play in various turn phases  --cards also provide resolution for the devastating Yellow Fever. THe game will include Player aids, hundreds of 6mm colored cubes (factional combat units), and several sheets of miscellaneous markers.

Name: Combat Command: World War II Skirmish Rules for 25mm Miniatures
Description:
Combat Command is a fully playable set of rules that allow you to fight larger skirmish actions of World War II in four hours or less!

Only 18 pages of core rules, all writen in an easy to read style, backed up by over 140 pages of table of organization and equipment data - including airplanes - for all major nationalities!

Scale: one figure equal one man, one weapon, or one vehicle.

Name: Fun and Gnan: 2 in 1 Game Pack
Description:
This is a game from India published for the purpose of educating children in the teachings of the guru Gnani Purush Shri Ambalal Muljibhai Patel, also known as Dada Bhagwan. It consists of two separate boardgames: "Dada's World", which teaches about how to behave apropriately in given situations and answer questions about the guru's teachings; and "Guess, Who Am I?", which focuses on identifying role models.

Game 1 (Dada's World) - Players roll a die and move along a track which represents their journey through Dada's World, collecting rectangular plastic "coins" with a variety of point values. 
Landing on marked spaces along the track can either add points (Helped Poor Person: 100), subtract points (Killed a cockroach: -150), provide the opportunity to answer questions about Dada's teachings to earn points (Dadai Dhamaka), lose turns, take extra turns, go back to Home, and other similar effects. At certain points on the track, players have the opportunity to pay points to take a shorter route.
The winner is the first player to make a complete circuit of the track and return to the start space with 1500 points or more. Players who complete the track with fewer than 1500 points must go back to an earlier square and try to accumulate more points.

Game 2 (Guess, Who Am I?) - Players roll a die and move along a track collecting pieces of three separate puzzles. Most of the spaces on the board are marked with a statement associated with one of the three "role models" - Parents, Dadashri and Humanity. When landing on a space on the board, players must identify which role model is associated with the statement on that space (example: Space #17 "We should bow down to them every day" is associated with Parents). Correctly identifying the role model allows the player to take the puzzle piece associated with that space. 
Other spaces give the player a free random puzzle piece, allow the player to take a piece from another player, or cause the player to lose a turn. Players who reach the end of the track without winning the game move back to Start and continue to collect puzzle pieces.
To win, a player must collect all 12 pieces of one of the three puzzles. He may then assemble the puzzle to see a picture representing one of the role models, then flip the pieces over to reveal a message.

From the rule booklet:

Hello kids!!!

Time to enter DADA'S WORLD filled with excitement, fun & learn.....

This 2-in-1 Game Pack offer dual knowledge and fun, Get the tracks right from 'Home' to 'Simandhar City' and back 'Home' in Game 1. If you follow the rule you are IN, if you refrain then you commit a SIN.

Also recognize the ROLE MODELS of your life by learning their virtues and identifying them in Game 2. Abount Parents, Dadashri and humanity is what we get to learn.

Wow! So much to do, so much to learn, so little time we want more fun, then grab on this Game Pack 2-in-1.

Name: Raliul OLTCIT
Description:
From the original rules:
"OLTCIT Rally (Raliul OLCIT) is an attractive competition game created in order to learn the road signs along with their meaning, racing elements and specific terminology."

The game board is made from 65 modular plastic tiles, 43 having numbers on them.

After choosing the favorite color of your car, when your turn comes, you role one die and move on the board with a number of spaces equal with the number depicted on it. After this, you search the space number in the game rules to see what you have to do:pay taxes,receive points, low speed, high speed, going forward, going backwards, or do nothing (if the tile you are sitting on is blank).

In this way you can earn or lose points. The player with the highest score wins.

Name: Telegruv
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

Telegruv is the new party game that takes the classic game, Telephone, to the next level.  Draw cards illustrating popular dance moves including: The Twist, The Snake, and Brush Your Shoulders Off.  Perform these moves for your teammates and get ready to laugh as your team tries to keep your dance sequence intact all the way down the line.  The more moves that are completed correctly, the more points your team scores.

The game is ready to play and includes 95 dance cards of varying genre and difficulty, 5 wild cards, a 90-second sand timer, scoring pads, and pencils.

Telegruv is the party game that gets you on your feet!

Name: Call-It
Description: Call-it! is a fast-paced word-burst game. Each player has a category card that represents him/her (and it turned over for the other players to have memorized).  The players take turns flipping symbol cards.  When you reveal a symbol that matches an opponent, you have to be the first to call out a word from their category in order to win their card.  The person who collects the most cards wins.

Name: Smart Darts
Description: It takes more than a steady hand and an eagle eye to win at this dart-based trivia game. Players or teams compete to score points by throwing their magnetic darts at the target. To score points, you must answer questions based on the color-coded category you land on. Show your skills by trying to land on your favorite category such as Sports, Geography, Arts & Entertainment, and History. The first player or team to score 300 points wins the game!

Name: Contact!
Description:
Contact is a solitaire game, where the player manages and deploys small naval task groups to accomplish random missions that will make up a campaign.

There are two major parts in this game:
- The mission planning/resource management
- The mission execution itself.

First the player determines what forces he will use depending on ships available and mission limitations.
Then, the player allocates weapons (anti ship and anti sub resources) to the platforms he chose.
Finally, the mission itself takes place, where the player deploys the task force in formation (by using a board that mimics a Radar display), and tries to accomplish the mission objectives, that include amongst others:

- Sub hunting
- Convoy Escort
- Sea Superiority
- Convoy raid
- Blockade
- Strategic Strikes

Each mission will have a variable number of turns to be completed and specific objectives, but the Tactical Cards may change all that! Sometimes Intel fails miserably!

The game is composed by:

- 24 Mission Cards - They will define the mission, the objectives, Victory Points, Standing Orders, Rules of Engagement
- 27 Tactical Cards - Will contain random events that will occur throughout the mission.
- 1 Game Board / Radar Display - Where the action takes place!
- 45 Ship Cards - Contain all the relevant information for each unit.
- 45 Ship Counters - To represent the ship card in the board.
- More than 100 counters representing the weapons used by the friendly forces and OPFOR.
- 64 Opposing Force unit counters, that can be either deployed by mission card or drawn randomly by Tactical cards. These include ships, subs and air raids.
- 36 contact counters - Using NTDS symbols, these will represent the location of the enemy forces (or uknown/neutral ones!), until they are positively identified.
- A few system counters
- 1D10 and 1D6 dice will be needed

As a starting point, this game will have one campaign included (Cold War 1985), but others can be easily added later, either by just using the existing components/era settings or by creating new ones.

WEBSITE (under construction): www.pbshots.biz/contact

Name: Obelix
Description:
Obelix is a fast paced strategy game for 2-4 players, where the goal is to build Towers and control territory  faster than your opponents. The trick is – you don’t know which Towers will grow and which will stagnate until the very last moment!

Players begin by constructing a gameboard from territory cards, dealt randomly to each player. No game will ever take place on the same board. Each player begins the game with six territories of their own color, and each territory begins with a random number of Obelix (between 1 and 6).

Attacking an enemy territory is as simple as rolling dice for as many Obelix as a player controls, with one catch - the winner takes the territory without a scratch while the opponent loses every Obelix on the card. Players attack and defend while reinforcing territories via the luck of the dice, and the first player to place all of their Obelix on the board takes the win.

Name: Pixl
Description:
Pixl is an abstract strategy game based around the balance of elements (fire, earth, water, and spirit). Players lay down blocks of their color and attempt to convert or erase opposing elements -if a Pixl is cornered by two pieces of the opposition a number of points may be awarded depending on the status of the opponent. Each player has the advantage when pursuing their "prey" element and must be eternally weary of their "predator" - who is always hunting them.

The game is structured so as to create an abstracted modern art piece by the conclusion of every game, as the elemental Pixls spiral around each other. While each player has a multitude of Pixls, only one piece in the game (the Port) may move - players must work to master the immobile Pixls and the Port necessary for their survival.

Name: Lawyer, the Game
Description:
From the rulesheet:

"The object of Lawyer, the Game is to be the Player with the most money at the end of the game.  You make money when you land on teal squares and you lose money when you land on fuchsia squares.  Suing and being sued are another way to make or lose money.  And at the end of the game, merchandise that you purchased along the way to The Good Life is figured into your final assets at a value 2 to 3 times greater than its original purchase price."

A simple roll-and-move game with a spiraling track, and spaces where you can pick up event type cards and buy merchandise.  Has event spaces that allow you to "Sue your Neighbor", at which time the player may choose to "sue" any other player, for whatever made-up reason they choose.  Lawsuits are settled by die rolls.

Game also comes with several dime store type toys that represent merchandise.

Game is subtitled "The hilarious game of negotiation and frivolous lawsuits".

Name: Bible Baseball
Description:
This is a religious-themed trivia game. The trivia questions are religious in nature and are asked and answered in a mechanism simulating a simple baseball game.
 Contents include: game board, question & answer booklet, eight markers (pegs), 6 sided die. Instructions are included in the Q&A booklet

Name: Chocolade Bordspel
Description:
The board has 22 square spaces in two colors. Each player places chocolates on the spaces in his/her color. They can use the chocolates of 'Sinterklaas' and 'Zwarte Piet' together.
every turn a player moves a chocolate to an empty space. When you jump over another chocolate, the chocolate is removed from the board. It's allowed to jump over chocolates on the spaces of your own color.
The first player who has no chocolates left, wins the game.

Name: Potions Festival
Description:
Wizards and sorcerers from all around the world get together in a contest of potions.  They open the old Grimoires and start selecting potions and ingredients.  The rules are strict and only the best will prevail.

Potions Festival is card game were the players collect ingredients to make potions.  The ingredients are at the center of table and the potions are hidden.  The ingredient cards are placed or moved to match the sequence of the potion..  They must lie in single path.  You can choose any needed ingredients as long as
they are connected in a single path. You cannot backtrack at the
path or pass twice by a card.

There are four kinds of ingredients and three types of magic.  At the end of the game additional points are earned by who have most from each type of magic and also for those who collected all three types.

Includes:

•Red Deck (33 cards)
•Blue Deck (40 cards)
•Game Rules Document

Name: Cabin Fever
Description:
Game Overview
Cabin Fever is a small, dice-based scoring game with the theme of escaping a cabin during a harsh winter. Players begin the game "snowed in" requiring them to "dig out," or score 100 points before they may begin collecting points. The first player to score 1,000 or more points wins the game! The game has a strategy component where players may trap other players in the cabin, preventing them from scoring.

Special scoring situations have easily recognizable winter themed monikers. Players encounter obstacles along the way in the form of certain types of die rolls ("squalls," "thaws," "broken chairlifts") which may end their turn or put them in the cabin. In addition to obstacles there are special die rolls that immediately reward a player such as "vacations" and "chairlifts".

Setup
Cabin Fever is designed for 2-8 players with an optimal number of 3 or more players. A game can be played with more than 8 players at the consequence of extending the game's duration. All that is needed in addition to the game is a pad of paper and a pencil or pen with which to keep score.

Gameplay
Each player rolls a single die to determine who starts the game. The highest roll goes first (after resolving ties). All players are considered “snowed in” and must "dig out" by rolling 100 points or more on the scoring dice. Once a player digs out he or she ends his or her turn and passes the scoring dice to the next player on the left (clockwise) and may begin scoring on his or her next turn. The first player to accumulate 1,000 points wins the game!

The five same color dice included with the game are called scoring dice. Players start a turn by rolling all five dice (opening roll) in an attempt to create matching die faces. Players may elect to end their turn at any time and collect their points (with a minimum requirement of a matching pair). Players may continue a turn to earn more points but must roll at least one match to an existing match, or create a new matching set on each consecutive re-roll of non-matching dice. Dice that have been assigned to a match may not be re-rolled. If players fail to roll a match on a re-roll they immediately end their turn and do not collect any points.

Components
    * 5 Scoring Dice (white)
    * 1 Vacation Die (green)
    * Cabin game piece (clear)
    * Cabin Fever rules sheet
    * 3 "I have Cabin Fever!" stickers
    * Palm-sized, clear acrylic, travel box

Name: Sicic
Description:
Sicic is a game for two. Each player guides a group of Astronomers, aiming at copying the opponent’s Constellation. Sicic is played on two 8 × 8 squared boards, named the Earth and the Sky. Each player has 4 pieces that move on the Earth (the Astronomers) and 4 pieces to be placed in the Sky (the Stars). The Stars are the player’s Constellation. There are three phases: the Afternoon, the Evening and the Night. One of the player will be the first to move in every phase of the game.

In the Afternoon, players alternate placing one Astronomer at a time on the Earth, on an empty square. In the Evening, players alternate placing one Star at a time in the Sky, on an empty square. In the Night, each player must move one of his Astronomer every turn. The Astronomer can move in a direct line in every direction, any number of unoccupied squares. He must land in an unoccupied square. The Astronomer may choose not to move, in order to “pinch” one of the opponent’s Astronomers set in a neighbouring square. The result of a pinch is that the pinched Astronomer must move in the next turn. Moreover, it is forbidden to the opponent, in the second next turn, to pinch an Astronomer that occupies the abandoned square.

The winner is the first player who manages to place his Astronomers in the same way as the opponent’s Stars. Translations, reflections and rotations are allowed. Also, a player can win by pinching an Astronomer that is not able to move.

Sicic is latin for “stellae inerrantes caeli imitatio consequi”.

Online Play: Super Duper Games

Name: Sophia
Description:
Sophia is played on a 4x4 square board. Each player has two sets of 7 pieces.  Each set is a different shape.  One side of every piece is one color, and the other side is a different color.  (So that for instance one player has triangles with one side black and the other red, and the other player has squares, also with one side black and the other red). Each player controls a different shape, and each player aims to win by making a line of his or her particular colour.

Drop Phase: On alternate turns, each player drops one their pieces (displaying whichever colour they choose uppermost) on an empty cell.  When this phase ends, assuming neither player has achieved a win, there will be two empty cells left.

Move Phase: Player move alternately, and must do one of the following actions:
1. Move a friendly piece.
2. Jump a friendly piece over any other adjacent piece, flipping the latter over to display the color on the other side.  This is a "short jump" as in checkers/draughts, with no space between the initial positions of the moved piece and the flipped piece, nor between the flipped piece and the final position of the moved piece).
3. Takes no action player if he/she does not have any legal move available.

Goal: Play ends when one player wins by making a 4 in-a-row of their chosen color.

In the basic game, winning lines and jumps are permitted horizontally, vertically, and diagonally.  For longer and "more stable" variants, outlaw diagonals from the win conditions, or from jumps, or from both.

Name: Weave
Description:
This game is played on a 10x10 square board.
On each turn,each player drops a friendly stone on an empty cell.
Goal:Wins the player that connects his edges with an orthogonal or a diagonal group of friendly stones.

Name: Age of Steam Expansion: Switzerland
Description:
The Switzerland is a map for 3-4 players. Bond buybacks are permitted.

This is the same Switzerland expansion as was included in Winsome's Age of Steam Expansion: Austria, Switzerland & The Netherlands. It was made available for free by John Bohrer.

Name: MiYu the Game
Description:
With this game players will try to look into their future.

The game is placed in the center of the table. Each turn the player swings the pendulum above the board. The place where the pendulum lands decides wether a player has to use the 'moodring'. 
The 'moodring' at the end of the pendulum changes its color when it's put on the player's finger. The player takes the corresponding assignment card and has to fulfill the assignment.
The game also contents 'magic stones'. These stones are needed with some of the assignments.

The object of the game is to learn more about yourself, your friends or about your future.

Name: Identik Extension Rouge
Description: Identik, the red expansion, contains 40 cards thus adding 80 new images to the game, funnier and more hilarious than ever.

Name: Identik Extension Bleu
Description: Identik, the blue expansion, contains 40 cards thus adding 80 new images to the game, funnier and more hilarious than ever.

Name: Fruity Bugs
Description:
User Description:

Fruity Bugs is a game from the Tesco Junior range for 2 to 4 players aged 4 and up.  The game includes one clockwork, strawberry board, 4 worm cards (1 blue, 1 green, 1 red and 1 yellow) and 20 green worms with coloured tail ends, 5 worms in each of the 4 colours.

You set the game up by randomly placing the worms in the holes in the strawberry and then each player selects a colour.  The aim of the game is to be the first player to get all 5 worms in your colour.  There is a lever at the top of the board, pull it and release to make the worms start wiggling (you'll have to repeat this frequently throughout the game as it only lasts for 10 seconds or so).

Once started players take it in turns, beginning with the youngest player, to grab a worm from the strawberry.  If it matches their card they keep it, if not they put it back and then the next player goes.  You keep going around until one player gets all of their 5 worms.

This is a very simple kids memory game with a dexterity element as you try and grab the wiggling worms as they move up and down in the board.

Name: Walking Dots
Description: This game is played on a 8x8 square board. To begin, each player drops two friendly stones on empty cells. On each turn, each player either drops a friendly stone on an empty cell orthogonally adjacent to another friendly stone, or passes. When both players pass, the player with more stones on the board wins.

Name: Duplo
Description:
This game is played on a 8x8 square board.
Setup:Initially,each player drops two friendly stones on empty cells.
On each turn,each player expands a connected line of one or more friendly stones.
A line of stones expands by doubling its size in one of the two directions it is defined.
When the board is full,wins the player with more friendly stones.

Name: Justin Bieber Backstage Pass Game
Description: Publisher Description: Justin's got a special message for you. Be the first BACKSTAGE before your friends beat you there! Prove you got the lowdown on Justin's life and his music. Correctly answer the questions as you race through the concert hall. Justin's secret message is waiting for you backstage. Fast and fun, Justin's trivia will keep you and your friends guessing to see who's the biggest fan.

Name: Crossbows and Catapults Master Battle Set
Description:
Discover an amazing world of warrior heroes, towering castles and brilliant, all-action battles to play with your friends.

The gameplay is fantastic fun - including crossbows and catapults that really do work. Castle towers with "explosive" special effects that send your enemies flying and some serious spells to cast upon anyone who dares oppose you.

So set out your castle keeps, tents, towers, crossbows and catapults. Build your rampart defenses and place your warriors in strategic positions. Then take it in turns to fire your projectiles - including the deadly fireballs, boiling oil and boulder bursts. Destroy your enemies defenses and weapons of awesome power before the destroy you.

Good luck and may glorious victory be yours!

Name: Word Bluff Table Top Game
Description: This is a card game that is a bluffing word guessing game.  Each card has three possible answers for each word on the card.  Only one of them is correct, can you guess which one?

Name: Tin Star
Description:
This is a set of tactical rules for gun-fights and shoot-outs in the setting of the American Wild West.  The gun-fights take place as a table top miniature game which uses 25mm scale miniatures.  The rules cover everything that is needed to play including character design and stats, scenario creation and even rules for campaign games.  There are floor plans included in the rule book, or the game master can create their own.

The battles can take place outdoors for example in the middle of a western town, or even indoors, such as in saloons, banks, etc.  Once each player has his character or gang of characters, then each player takes turns moving and firing at each other until there is one player (or team) remaining.

Name: For a Few Miniatures More
Description: This is an expansion book for Fistfull of Miniatures, which contains Scenarios, Army Lists, and New Rules for A Fistfull of Miniatures.

Name: Alien Frontiers: The Mind Control Helmet
Description:
MIND CONTROL HELMET
Pay 3 Fuel to move an opponent's
ship to a different Orbital Facility and
use it as if it were your own ship.

The ship may not change value during the
move and may not be moved onto or
off the Terraforming Station.


The Mind Control Helmet costs more to use than the Orbital Teleporter because you're using a larger pool of other players' ships, almost guaranteeing you can find the right number to accomplish your goal.

It has all of the same restrictions as the Orbital Teleporter...
Cannot remove a ship from the Terraforming Station
Cannot change the ship's value in transit
Cannot use it at the same facility it came from

...plus one extra restriction...
Cannot move a ship onto the Terraforming Station


Two MCH cards were included free if you pre-ordered the base game from the second print run.

A limited quantity of MCH cards are available for separate purchase.

The MCH is included with all copies of the game as of the 3rd edition.

Name: Laste mälumängudoomino
Description:
Laste mälumängudoomino is a junior version of MÃ¤lumÃ¤ngudoomino

Game mechanics are the same: trivia game with domino pieces. The tiles have two categories marked on them, out of total ten. The tile placement follows normal domino rules, but each time you are placing a tile, you have to answer a question on the topic marked on the tile in question. The categories in the game are: history, people, nature, geography, computers & technology, entertainment, sports, Estonia, culture and various other information.

The game includes:
100 question cards with 1000 questions
55 domino tiles

Name: Yatzi Zoo
Description: Idea of the game: The zoo is in a muddle: all the animals may get out of their enclosures and are drawn today. The colour combination of the dice decides which is the next animal to be drawn to complete one's row. Who can draw the longest row of animals. A drawing and dice game. Contains rules for older players.

Name: Dealing With Murder: Dead & Breakfast
Description:
From the back of the box:
"Deal up murder and mayhem with the simple murder mystery game that's played with cards. 'Dealing with Murder' requires no fancy parties or petit'fours, just round up your favorite rival detectives and deal them into a baffling murder mystery which unfolds as the cards are dealt.
  
Who will be the first detective to identify the killer?  Will you cooperate with your fellow sleuths...or withhold some evidence...to give yourself an edge in solving the crime?

A singular murder mystery experience for 2 to 6 amateur detectives aged 12 to adult.

Contents include a unique 55 card deck of clues, tips and evidence; crime scene photos and suspect profiles; game instructions and a sealed crime solution.

Object of the Game:
To be the first detective to solve the crime by correctly stating 1)Who the murderer is 2) The motive, and 3) How it was accomplished.

Similar to/same series as:
Dealing With Murder: Fatal Error

Name: Muumien purnukkajahti
Description:
A simple roll and move game played on a board made of small wooden jigsaw pieces. The aim of the game is to have most jam in the end. Landing on a space may cause you to gain jam, lose jam, skip a turn or move forward on the track. Reaching the goal first gives a jam bonus.

Winner of the Children's Game of the Year 2010 in Finland.

Name: Rechenakrobat
Description:
Rechenakrobat (Calculation Acrobat)

Rechenakrobat is game consisting out of five dice only. It is a mathematical game in which the player tries to make a correct calculation with the thrown values of the dice.

With the eyes of the 5 coloured dice the number thrown with the 2 black dice should be calculated through addition, subtraction, multiplication or division.

"Lebst Du nur, oder spielst Du schon?" / "Still living, or already playing"?

Name: Secret Santa
Description:
Santa has infiltrated the home of Sam Malton, the founder of Mal-Mart. He's on a mission to give coal to the whole family, and if he succeeds, the Holiday season is saved from commercialism. If he fails, Sam and his naughty children will reap the rewards of consumer spending.


Each player randomly and secretly takes the role of one character; Santa , Elf, Sam, Kid, Naughty Kid. Sam and his kids are trying to figure out who Santa is, while Santa is trying to give everyone in the Malton family coal.

This is a rethemed and adapted version of a specialized version of Werewolf (no moderator needed).

Game Files Here
http://boardgamegeek.com/filepage/62211/secret-santa-rules
http://boardgamegeek.com/filepage/62151/secret-santa-components

Name: Nutimäng
Description:
From the publisher:
Nutimäng is made for 4-5 year old children. It is a simple story telling game, in which adults can aim their kids if needed.Each time you give your kid and question or task, let them finish it and then check the other side of the card if they got it. First child to collect 5 correct tasks/questions is the winner.

The game is put together from national children educational standards.

Name: Sobid või mitte?
Description:
From the publisher:
Easiest party game for couples. This game is a good way to learn about your friends and family, to find people who think like you.
The couple that wins the game is the one who "clicks" more and gets to the finish first. Only thing you need to do in this game is to pick words from word pairs and then check, if your partner thinks the same. Is it blond or dark - your choice?

Name: Roheline Tuli
Description:
From the publisher:
We all take part in traffic and knowing it is not just for drivers. This educational card game teaches about traffic and it contains 40 cards: 36 traffic sign, 3 traffic lights and 1 rule card. It can be used to teach about traffic signs, but it also is a party game for kids as well. The game is simple, you just need get rid of your cards by finding companion traffic sign. Sound easy enough, so now lets start teaching the youngsters...

Name: Collector
Description:
Collector is played on a 6x6 square board.
On each turn,a player must drop a friendly stone and a neutral stone,both on adjacent empty cells.
When all cells are occupied,wins the player with the largest group.
Collector is presented at 100 Strategic Games for Pen and Paper by Walter Joris.

Name: Summoner Wars: Khan Queso
Description:
Promotional card included in orders from Plaid Hat Games for a period.

Khan Queso is a Champion of the Mercenaries, and his special ability reads:

Plague
After moving Khan Queso, you must roll a die once for each unit that is adjacent to Khan Queso. On a result of 5 or higher, that unit receives one wound marker.

Name: Summoner Wars: Sairook
Description:
Promotional card included with orders from Plaid Hat Games for a limited time period.

Sairook is a Champion of the Mercenaries, his special ability reads:

Shadow Summon
If Sairook is on the battlefield at the end of your turn, you may choose to remove all wound markers from Sairook and place him back in your hand.

Name: Ambivalence
Description:
Ambivalence is played on a 6x6 square board. On each turn, each player drops a friendly stone on an empty cell.

In the following cases, stones are transformed into neutral stones:

    Custodian: An enemy stone becomes neutral when placed between two friendly stones.
    Intrusion: Two enemy stones becomes neutral when a friendly stone is dropped between them.


When the board is full, the player with more friendly stones wins.

Ambivalence is listed as Ambivalente in 100 Strategic Games for Pen and Paper by Walter Joris.

Name: Kill Ball
Description:
Kill Ball is a science fiction tabletop sports game for two players created by Gil Nicoll and Adam Watts. It uses tokens or minis on a gridded board to represent a match between two teams of human clones in a gritty arena environment.

Gameplay is an ultra-violent hybrid of handball and hockey. Clones are extremely disposable, and inflicting serious injuries and death upon the opponent’s team is a major part of the game’s strategy. A decapitation will add an additional ball to the arena which can also be used as weapon.

In leagues and tournaments, each player generates a unique team that carries on from game to game. Clones who suffer injuries or death in the arena will have temporary to permanent reductions to their stats, but are easily replaceable between matches. The ones that survive are awarded experience which can be used to improve attributes and purchase additional abilities.

Name: Dinner Party
Description: Players randomly and secretly pick a character from a pool of 10. Each player/character will host a dinner party consisting on a starter, a main dish, a dessert, drinks and entertainment all of them represented by cards with various choices of food, drink and entertainment. At the end of the game, each player will receive points from the rest depending on the various and particular tastes of their characters.

Name: Grid Snakes
Description:
Grid Snakes is a quick-playing game with some real-world dexterity elements for two, four, or six players (with variant rules for three, five, and seven to twelve players). You’re a digital snake, trapped in an arena with several other snakes. As you move, you leave body segments behind you. Your goal is to eliminate your opponents by forcing your opponents to crash into the edge of the board or and section of any other player.

Play is simultaneous (so there's no down time) and proceeds through the following phases: plan, challenge, resolve.  During planning, you have a just a handful seconds to pick a direction and a speed for your snake. When all instructions are revealed, any player may spend a token to challenge another player.  If you're challenged, you have to flick a token onto a chart; where it lands dictates your speed for the turn.  During resolution, you move the snakes, add body segments, and check for collisions.

Grid Snakes uses a large and a small custom board, several small custom decks of cards (eight cards each), some nickels or quarters, and a lot of colored glass beads (or other small tokens). The rules and cards are available at: http://www.invisible-city.com/file_download/165/

Grid Snakes has fairly simple rules, but requires quick decision making and planning. Grid Snakes is appropriate for ages 12 and up. If you eliminate the timer, you could probably play this game with slightly younger children. If you allow multiple attempts on reflex challenges, you could go even younger. A four-player game takes 30 minutes or fewer to play. A six-player game takes 40 minutes or fewer.

Name: RoboRally: King of the Hill
Description:
The finalists of the RoboRally tournament which transpired at the Origins Game Fair in 1999 each received a copy of the King of the Hill board. While it is virtually impossible to obtain an original, the fan community has produced an accurate print-and-play version available for download.

King of the Hill incorporates various elements from previous expansions published by Wizards of the Coast—most notably being one of only three boards to utilize ramps and ledges—while exclusively featuring the 'steep ramp' element which, unlike normal ramps, requires three movements worth of momentum in order to ascend.

Name: Chairman of the Board
Description:
Object: Become Chairman of the Board, the winner must have a minimum of 51% of the stock of his company and a minimum score of $255,000. The highest score wins.

Players take turns picking up a Situation card, adding or subtracting value to the score sheet and/or move along the gameboard.  Some cards allow you to choose between increasing/decreasing your net worth or moving your playing piece forwards/backwards while other cards will have you to both.

The are other squares on the gameboard which involve Conflict/Advantage cards and Corporate Investment cards. Conflict/Advantage cards are played when picked up. These cards are similar to the Situation cards but some are Advantage cards which can cause other people to lose a percent of their income, move backwards and other 'take-that' actions.

Corporate Investment cards are kept face down and typically add to your wealth but amounts vary. They are added in towards the end of the game.

Contents include game board, score sheet, 4 player pawns, 72 situation cards, 35 conflict/advantage cards, 30 corporate cards, and insert with the instructions on them

Name: Identik "Pizza Hut"- mini-expansion
Description:
Mini-expansion included in Pizza Hut's "Helaba!"-magazine no 43. (magazine edited in Belgium for Pizza Hut)
This mini-expansion has 2 new cards for the game "Identik":
The dutch cards are:
- Sliertenbezweerder (stringscharmer)
- Dolle koeien (mad cows)
- Tussendoortje (snack)
- De beste vriend van de hond (a dog's best friend)

Name: Hidden Gems
Description:
This tile laying games pits two players against each other, trying to build point-winning diamonds and rubies, whilst blocking your opponent's efforts.

There are bonus tiles that let you make double moves or swap out tiles from the game.

The tiles are rhombus-shaped, with 30 per player, and each player takes their turn adding a tile to the table, one at a time, until the winner is declared.

Name: Americana! Travel Edition
Description:
From the Back of the Box:

Looking for the Real America?  Here's a card-capture trivia game with a huge heaping of awesome questions from every corner and generation of the good ole' U.S.A.!  Keep to the easier road with Civil Lore! cards, or take to the backroads with really tough Cannon Fodder cards!

Trivia Categories and Descriptions from the Back of the Box:

Secret Natures - Native American Myths, National Parks, Legendary Creatures, Amazing Oddities

Town Halls - Iconic Americana, President Lore, Crazy Laws, Holiday Traditions, Regional Customs

Country Roads - Folk Heroes, Roadside Attractions, Farm Life, Appalachian Ways, Old West Sayings

Modern Airwaves - Radio Days, Behind the Scenes, Classic Television, Business of Hollywood

Urban Scenes - Streetside Games, Urban Legends, Fads & Trends, Great Ballparks, Literary Gems

Futurescapes - Technocultures, Origins of Everyday Things, Sci-Fi Snippets, Future Visions
Families: Versions & Editions: Travel Versions of Non-Travel Games

Name: Space Strips
Description:
Space Strips is a print-and-play solo game. It is inspired by the famous Space Invaders game.
Your mission is to get to your destination with your spaceship and to destroy as many invaders as you can. You move your spaceship on an area that is made of paper strips. Each turn, you remove the lowest strip and add a new one above the others : the "boardgame" always changes. Your spaceship moves up one square. If a meteorite or some invaders come accross your way, you have to fight them with 1, 2 or 3 dice. The game ends when you reach the Destination strip or when your Armor points come down to 0. Then you count your points : 50 is a good score.

Name: Tigele
Description:
Tigele is the first volume of a 4 volume game/game system. Tigele like the other Volumes is a standalone game. Meaning as it comes out of the box,  it is a working game. Tigele may be added to other volumes as an expansion. Or the other volumes may be added to it, in part or whole, as expansions. Or this volume may be mixed with parts of the other volumes to form whole new games.

Tigele is a battle strategy game made up of 100 tiles comprised of 72 pictographs forming just several tile types. the game was played by a small community of individuals in the North west corner of Montana for almost 20 years. Slowly evolving into this publish version. (Long cold winters and beer)

Oddities of the game:
1) We call the game a board game, even though it is a tile game; because, the tiles in part make up the playing area, a 10 X 10 layout of tile we call a field. The field is comprised of two opponents laid out in 10 X 5 (1/2 the field we call the courts). That area once established remains a constant grid for play throughout the game. Thus the tiles making a randomized board.

2) The tiles used above are the playing board and the playing pieces.

3) The game uses the relationships of one tiles to another as a mechanic to manipulate luck, and unforeseen or uncontrolled  events. This also encourages ever developing tactics and interpersonal strategies (more so when later volumes are played in concert with one another).

4) The box instructions gives two player mode instruction. but the game plays up to 4 players in the Volume One level. The 3 and 4 player modes of play are suggested on our web site.

5) The game was designed for two primary reasons. To help keep the designer brother out of trouble and as a model of one basic form of social political behavior...Don't ask me.

6) Hard rules augmented with a few soft rules. the soft rules force personal interaction and create a fog of war atmosphere...again don't ask me...it just works.

7) Players on your side of play may or may not really be playing on your side.

8) The game uses its art as a fog of war mechanism.

9) The game has a slight learning curve; but the game is basic in  play.

Name: Tobruk Expansion Pack 6: Killing Fields
Description:
ATS Expansion Pack 6- Killing Fields continues the series of expansions for the first ATS series boxed game Advanced Tobruk. Ownership of that game and American Personnel and Vehicle counters are required to play the scenarios included in the set.  Killing Fields adds new vehicles and overlays to the system including a 22" long escarpment overlay.  The thirteen scenarios included represent WWII actions in North Africa  with the Americans, British, Germans, and Italians.

ATS is a tactical level wargame system with each turn representing about 90 seconds of real time and each hex representing 50 yards of terrain.  Each weapon and vehicle counter represents one weapon or vehicle. Personnel counters represent squads, crews, forward observers, BAR gunners, and leaders.

Name: San Guo Sha: Wind
Description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION

    
    
         The information that BGG has on this item indicates that San Guo Sha is an unauthorized reproduction of BANG! with just a few differences, published in China and distributed in several coutries of the world.

    



This is the first expansion of San Guo Sha, aka Killers of the Three Kingdoms. As a character expansion, this expansion introduces 8 new character cards but no new playing cards. In addition, this expansion also includes 2 Demi-God characters randomly inserted into some boosters. Rarity is unknown.
Families: Theme: Romance of the Three Kingdoms

Name: San Guo Sha: Battle
Description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION
